sen.j: 大伴馬来田（おおとも の まくた、生年不詳 - 天武天皇12年6月3日 (旧暦)（683年7月2日））は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: OTOMO no Makuta (year of birth unknown - July 2, 683) lived in the Asuka period in Japan.
OTOMO no Makuta (year of birth unknown - July 2, 683) lived during Japan's Asuka period.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「おほとものまくた」。

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で大海人皇子（天武天皇）について活躍した。
sen.e: He actively supported Prince Oama during the Jinshin War in 672.
He actively supported Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) during the Jinshin War of 672.

sen.j: 大伴氏は飛鳥時代の有力氏族である。
sen.e: The Otomo clan was a powerful clan in the Asuka period.
The Otomo clan was a powerful clan in the Asuka period.

sen.j: 大伴馬来田は大伴咋の子で、兄に大伴長徳、弟に大伴吹負、子に大伴道足がいた。
sen.e: OTOMO no Makuta's father was OTOMO no Kui, his elder brother was OTOMO no Nagatoko, his younger brother was OTOMO no Fukei and his son was OTOMO no Michitari.
OTOMO no Makuta's father was OTOMO no Kui, his elder brother was OTOMO no Nagatoko, his younger brother was OTOMO no Fukei and his son was OTOMO no Michitari.

sen.j: 大伴氏は大伴長徳が孝徳天皇につかえて重職にあったが、 白雉2年（651年）に長徳が亡くなってから不遇であった。
sen.e: Although OTOMO no Nagatoko had an important post during the Emperor Kotoku period, the Otomo clan experienced hardships after Nagatoko died in 651.
Although OTOMO no Nagatoko had an important post during the Emperor Kotoku's period, the Otomo clan experienced hardships after Nagatoko died in 651.
sen.cmt: Emperor Kotoku periodに'sを付記しました。

sen.j: そのため壬申の乱の前に馬来田は病気を称して都から退き、弟の大伴吹負とともに倭（大和国）の自宅にいた。
sen.e: Because of this, Makuta left the capital under the pretense of illness before the Jinshin War and stayed at home in Yamato (Yamato Province) with his brother, OTOMO no Fukei.

sen.j: 彼等は次の天皇は吉野宮にいる大海人皇子だろうと考えていた。
sen.e: They believed that next emperor would be Prince Oama who was in Yoshino no miya.
They believed that next emperor would be Prince Oama who was in Yoshino no miya.

sen.j: 6月24日に大海人皇子が挙兵を決意して行動を起こすと、馬来田らは大海人皇子に味方することを決めた。
sen.e: When Prince Oama took up arms on Jun 24, Makuta and his family decided to support Prince Oama.
When Prince Oama took up arms on June 24, Makuta and his family decided to support Prince Oama.

sen.j: 吹負は大和に残って同志を募り、馬来田はまず吉野宮に行った。
sen.e: Fukei stayed in Yamato to gather comrades and Makuta went to Yoshino no miya first.
Fukei stayed in Yamato to gather comrades and Makuta went to Yoshino no miya first.

sen.j: しかし大海人皇子は去った後で、馬来田は黄書大伴とともに皇子を追い、その日のうちに莬田（大和国宇陀郡）の吾城で追いついた。
sen.e: However Prince Oama had already departed and Makuta followed the prince with KIFUMI no Otomo and caught up with him on the same day at Aki in Toda (Uda-gun, Yamato Province).
However Prince Oama had already departed and Makuta followed the prince with KIFUMI no Otomo and caught up with him on the same day at Aki in Toda (Uda-gun, Yamato Province).

sen.j: 黄書大伴はこの日に倭京（飛鳥の古都）に使者にたって戻るところで、どの時点で馬来田と会ったかは『日本書紀』に明記されないが、大伴兄弟に事を知らせた当人である可能性が高い。
sen.e: KIFUMI no Otomo was on the way back from a city in Yamato as an envoy on this day and when he met up with Makuta isn't reported in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) but it is highly possible that he reported Prince Oama's act to the Otomo brothers.

sen.j: この後、吹負は大和方面の将軍として華々しい活躍をしたが、馬来田の軍功は伝わらない。
sen.e: Later, Fukei was very successful as a general in the Yamato area, but Makuta's military exploits were not recorded.

sen.j: 戦場に立てば必ず指揮官のうちに名を挙げられたはずなので、馬来田は戦場に出なかったと推測できる。
sen.e: It is assumed that Makuta didn't go to the war front although he could have made his mark as a commander if he had gone into battle.
If he had gone into battle, his name must have been on the list of commanders; therefore, it is assumed that Makuta didn't go to the war front.

sen.j: 大海人皇子を補佐して後方にいたのであろう。
sen.e: He was behind the lines supporting Prince Oama.
He was probably behind the lines supporting Prince Oama.

sen.j: 戦後、馬来田が功により100戸を封じられたことが『続日本紀』大宝元年 (701年）7月21日条から知られる。
sen.e: According to July 21, 701 of "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued), Makuta was allotted 100 households for his achievement after the war.

sen.j: 壬申の乱で大海人皇子に味方した氏族は中小のものが多く、馬来田は大伴氏を率いる立場にあって非常な高位にあったはずなのだが、『日本書紀』が記す天武朝の事績の中に馬来田の名は現れない。
sen.e: There are no achievements of Makuta during the Tenmu dynasty reported in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) even though he was the leader of the Otomo clan and a very highly ranked person and many of clans who supported Prince Oama in the Jinshin War was small and medium sized.

sen.j: 統治の実権は天武天皇自身が握り、皇族が重用された。
sen.e: Emperor Tenmu held the real power of government and gave important posts to the Imperial family.

sen.j: 天皇は大いに驚き、泊瀬王を遣わして弔問し、壬申の乱での望多の勲と、大伴氏の先祖が代々果たした功を述べさせ、賞を下した。
sen.e: The Emperor was greatly surprised and sent Hatsuse no miko to express condolence, state the achievements Mouda (望陀) made during the Jinshin War and the merits of the Otomo clan established for generations and granted it a reward.
